DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator to signify whether a core needle breast biopsy was performed

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a core biopsy, the removal of a tissue sample using a needle with a relatively large diameter, as a diagnostic surgical procedure, involving an incision and/or the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue being performed or carred out._One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Have you ever had a core need
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have you ever had a core needle biopsy (excluding fine needle aspiration)? This is the removal of a piece of breast tissue using a large needle, and usually done under a local anaesthetic under the guidance of ultrasound, MRI, or x-ray (sometimes called Stereotactic biopsy).
